item.title: Sensex jumps 400 points, Nifty 50 ends above 24,700— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today

review.headline_rewrite: Sensex jumps 400 points, Nifty 50 ends above 24,700— 10 key highlights from the Indian stock market today
bullets: The Sensex closed the day with a gain of 410 points, or 0.51 per cent, at 80,567.71, while the Nifty 50 rose 135 points,
The BSE Midcap index rose 0.63 per cent, while the Smallcap index jumped 0.90 per cent.
The overall market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms rose to nearly ₹453 lakh crore from ₹450 lakh crore in the previous session, making investors richer
All categories of consumer-based sectors, like discretionary, durable and staples, continued to outperform," Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Investments Limited, observed.

item.title: Stock market today: 64 stocks hit 52-week lows, 126 stocks at 52-week high as Nifty 50, Sensex end in green

review.headline_rewrite: Stock market today: 64 stocks hit 52-week lows, 126 stocks at 52-week high as Nifty 50, Sensex end in green
bullets: Benchmark equity indices Sensex and Nifty 50 ended the day positively in a volatile session on Wednesday, fueled by a surge in metal stocks
After moving between peaks and troughs, the Sensex rose by 409.83 points or 0.51 percent, closing at 80,567.71.
In the near future, market sentiment will depend on the results of the GST Council meeting, particularly affecting consumption-driven stocks and sectors.

item.title: Promoter group firms infuse ₹3,956 cr in Jio Financial

review.headline_rewrite: Promoter group firms infuse ₹3,956 cr in Jio Financial
bullets: Jio Financial Services Ltd (JFSL) reported a 4 per cent increase in consolidated net profit to ₹325 crore in the first quarter ended June

item.title: Rupee recovers 9 paise from all-time low to close at 88.06 against US dollar

review.headline_rewrite: Rupee recovers 9 paise from all-time low to close at 88.06 against US dollar
bullets: The rupee recovered 9 paise from its all-time low level to settle at 88.06 (provisional) against US dollar on Wednesday, on positive domestic equities,
Forex traders said the rupee is trading near all-time low levels amid persistent foreign fund outflows on the back of ongoing trade tariff concerns
At the interbank foreign exchange market, the rupee opened at 88.15 against the US dollar, then fell to an intraday low of 88.19 and
On Tuesday, the rupee declined 5 paise to close at an all-time low of 88.15 against the US dollar.
